summary: The implementation successfully delivers all 11 requirements for the CareerSphere career guidance platform. The landing page includes the hero section with proper branding, navigation, and CTA button (REQ-1). All 8 module cards are implemented with icons, descriptions, and explore buttons in a responsive grid (REQ-2). Individual pages exist for Career Path with dropdown selector (REQ-3), Stream Selector Quiz (REQ-4), India vs Abroad comparison with visual indicators (REQ-5), Chatbot interface (REQ-6), FutureMap visual journey (REQ-7), Degree Finder with search (REQ-8), About section with problem statement and mission/vision (REQ-9), Contact form with validation and footer social links (REQ-10), and consistent modern UI design with blue/purple gradients and responsive layouts (REQ-11). Two module placeholders (Regional Language and AR Explorer) link back to the modules page as specified in non-goals.

hallucinated_features.description: Login page with Internet Identity integration and traditional email/password form
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals explicitly state 'User authentication system implementation (Login link is UI only)'. The implementation includes functional Internet Identity hooks, authentication state management, and login flow logic beyond just UI.

hallucinated_features.description: Functional chatbot with response logic and message state management
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals explicitly state 'Backend AI functionality for the chatbot (UI only)'. The Chatbot page includes getBotResponse() function with conditional logic that generates contextual responses based on user input, going beyond UI-only implementation.

hallucinated_features.description: Quiz result calculation logic in Stream Selector
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals state no 'Database integration for storing user quiz results'. While the quiz displays questions and accepts answers as required, the StreamResult page may contain logic that calculates stream recommendations beyond simple UI display, though this is borderline as basic client-side calculation could be considered part of the UI flow.
